cwe_description: The software reads data past the end, or before the beginning, of the intended buffer. This can lead to crashes, information disclosure, or other undefined behavior.
explanation: The code is vulnerable to an out-of-bounds read. The line `si->sps = &avc->sps[si->pps->sps_id + GF_SVC_SSPS_ID_SHIFT];` uses an index derived from `si->pps->sps_id`, which is a value parsed from the input bitstream. There are no bounds checks performed on `si->pps->sps_id` or the resulting sum before it is used to access the `avc->sps` array. An attacker can craft a malicious bitstream with a large `sps_id` value, causing an out-of-bounds read from `avc->sps`. This can lead to information disclosure, denial of service, or potentially arbitrary code execution.

cwe_description: The software reads data past the end, or before the beginning, of the intended buffer. This can lead to crashes, information disclosure, or other undefined behavior.
explanation: The code uses si->pps->sps_id as an index into the avc->sps array without proper bounds checking. An attacker can craft a malicious bitstream with an out-of-range sps_id value, leading to an out-of-bounds read when accessing avc->sps[si->pps->sps_id + GF_SVC_SSPS_ID_SHIFT]. This can result in a denial of service (crash) or potentially information disclosure or arbitrary code execution depending on the memory layout and subsequent usage of the corrupted si->sps pointer.
